The San Francisco Giants are an American baseball team. Their 2012 season marked
their 130th year in Major League Baseball, as well as their fifty-fifth year in
San Francisco since their move from New York following the 1957 season, and the
thirteenth at AT&T Park. The Giants finished with a record of 94â68, 1st place
in the NL West, and beat the Cincinnati Reds in five games in the Division
Series thereby becoming the first National League team (8th in MLB History) to
come back from a 2â0 deficit in a best-of-five series by sweeping three games in
the opponent's park. The Giants defeated the St. Louis Cardinals in seven games
in the NL Championship Series and advanced to the 2012 World Series to face the
Detroit Tigers. They swept the Tigers in four games to win their second World
Series title in three years.
categories: 2012 Major League Baseball season|San Francisco Giants
